KH.content: what Marx calls “Egyptian model” [fn refers to unpublished seminar on khōra & Marx, Hegel], ekmageion, print-bearer, imprint, seal
KH.linkedContent: what Marx calls “Egyptian model” [fn refers to unpublished seminar on khōra & Marx, Hegel], ekmageion, print-bearer, imprint, seal

GOD.content: another secret, another seal (supplementary seal), comes to overlay (sceller) the unlivable experience, another concealment (cèlement) to the tremor > afraid of the fear, tremble in form of not knowing: a double secret [trembling as supplementary seal?]
GOD.linkedContent: another secret, another seal (supplementary seal), comes to overlay (sceller) the unlivable experience, another concealment (cèlement) to the tremor > afraid of the fear, tremble in form of not knowing: a double secret [trembling as supplementary seal?]

GOD.content: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and jealously sealed: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?
GOD.linkedContent: reader of literature hypnotized, paralyzed before suspended perplexity, before secret path of secret, exposed and jealously sealed: who says what to whom? who asks forgiveness?

GOD.content: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)
GOD.linkedContent: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)

GOD.content: singularity is sealed & betrayed by inheritance that confirms, reads, translates the covenant
GOD.linkedContent: singularity is sealed & betrayed by inheritance that confirms, reads, translates the covenant

GOD.content: literature inherits from Abraham, betrays him
GOD.linkedContent: literature inherits from Abraham, betrays him

LOBL.content: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives
LOBL.linkedContent: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives

LOBL.content: ring is sealed by arrêt de mort (syntax, almost untranslatable, is sealed in this French expression)
LOBL.linkedContent: ring is sealed by arrêt de mort (syntax, almost untranslatable, is sealed in this French expression)

LOBL.content: commitment [wedding proposal] in irresponsibility of speech [Blanchot’s character proposes in Slavic not French], arrêt of commitment, commitment thus arrêté, both in one’s language & the other’s—the hymen > mother tongue does away w/ commitment & seals it
LOBL.linkedContent: commitment [wedding proposal] in irresponsibility of speech [Blanchot’s character proposes in Slavic not French], arrêt of commitment, commitment thus arrêté, both in one’s language & the other’s—the hymen > mother tongue does away w/ commitment & seals it

SPOM.content: [re: translation of “the time is out of joint”] each translation aggravates, seals the inaccessibility to other language
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: translation of “the time is out of joint”] each translation aggravates, seals the inaccessibility to other language

SPOM.content: does Marx’s exorcism sign and seal the whole logic of Capital? however virtual, preparatory > is this conjuration ceremony, vital surviving oath, injunction, what puts Capital in motion, and part of the revolutionary promise?
SPOM.linkedContent: does Marx’s exorcism sign and seal the whole logic of Capital? however virtual, preparatory > is this conjuration ceremony, vital surviving oath, injunction, what puts Capital in motion, and part of the revolutionary promise?

HERP.content: Heidegger’s 3 creative “Gewalten” of historial destiny: poet, thinker, statesman > their work as Schaffen carries seal or signature of originary polemos/Kampf
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 creative “Gewalten” of historial destiny: poet, thinker, statesman > their work as Schaffen carries seal or signature of originary polemos/Kampf

POOF.content: une archi-amitié s’inscrirait à même le sceau du testament [not Ciceronian exemplar]
POOF.linkedContent: une archi-amitié s’inscrirait à même le sceau du testament [not Ciceronian exemplar]

POOF.content: Nietzsche: where metaphysicians have set their seal, perhaps it’s a ‘frog-perspective’
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: where metaphysicians have set their seal, perhaps it’s a ‘frog-perspective’

POOF.content: via & beyond Schmitt, der geschwisterlichen Klang (the brotherly-sisterly sound), the obscure friendship of rhyme, insane linking (appariement) of a couple, sense is born in a pair > before being philosophical, friendship concerns gift of the poem, isn’t there always a politics of a rhyme? > the rhyme can also become a traffic signal (philautie of linkage) > nothing looks more like the traffic signals of one country than those of another: this is the law > everything begins w/ Echo: rhymes sign, in cadence they seal a belonging, an ‘open gate’ [?]
POOF.linkedContent: via & beyond Schmitt, der geschwisterlichen Klang (the brotherly-sisterly sound), the obscure friendship of rhyme, insane linking (appariement) of a couple, sense is born in a pair > before being philosophical, friendship concerns gift of the poem, isn’t there always a politics of a rhyme? > the rhyme can also become a traffic signal (philautie of linkage) > nothing looks more like the traffic signals of one country than those of another: this is the law > everything begins w/ Echo: rhymes sign, in cadence they seal a belonging, an ‘open gate’ [?]

HASD.content: seal: figures the figuration of the unfigurable itself, seal as imprint displaces typography of khora > khora—makes copies of paradigm; seal—valid for entire text of creation
HASD.linkedContent: seal: figures the figuration of the unfigurable itself, seal as imprint displaces typography of khora > khora—makes copies of paradigm; seal—valid for entire text of creation

HASD.content: text of creation exists as typographic inscription of nonparticipation in participation
HASD.linkedContent: text of creation exists as typographic inscription of nonparticipation in participation

HASD.content: Acc. Eckhart, imprint whole/identical, model will change based on wax (human) used
HASD.linkedContent: Acc. Eckhart, imprint whole/identical, model will change based on wax (human) used

MPM.content: affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else
MPM.linkedContent: affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else

MPM.content: ”yes” commits w/ no content must repeat itself: yes yes, must bind itself to memory for memory, if anything’s to come from future [alliance btwn memory and seal of yes, yes]
MPM.linkedContent: ”yes” commits w/ no content must repeat itself: yes yes, must bind itself to memory for memory, if anything’s to come from future [alliance btwn memory and seal of yes, yes]

MPM.content: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other

A.content: via Seneca, death (immanence of a disappearance) seals union of possible and impossible
A.linkedContent: via Seneca, death (immanence of a disappearance) seals union of possible and impossible

A.content: death w/out limit as limit to cross (pas)
A.linkedContent: death w/out limit as limit to cross (pas)

SEC.content: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, dividing the seal [see LI pp. 30-1]
SEC.linkedContent: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, dividing the seal [see LI pp. 30-1]

VM.content: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space
VM.linkedContent: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

PAS.content: from where the right to interrupt? unjustifiable violence of interruption, nothing more servile, indiscreet, unspeakable than generalizing, appropriating the unique, breaking the seal of an absolute singularity [re: citing from Friendship, on single friendship btwn Bataille & Blanchot]
PAS.linkedContent: from where the right to interrupt? unjustifiable violence of interruption, nothing more servile, indiscreet, unspeakable than generalizing, appropriating the unique, breaking the seal of an absolute singularity [re: citing from Friendship, on single friendship btwn Bataille & Blanchot]

SH.content: circumcision only once, at the same time “first & last,” ring, seal of alliance, anniversary of archeology/eschatology > ring traces, carves the “unwiederholbar (unrepeatable)”
SH.linkedContent: circumcision only once, at the same time “first & last,” ring, seal of alliance, anniversary of archeology/eschatology > ring traces, carves the “unwiederholbar (unrepeatable)”

SH.content: “one time” in English, but “one turn,” “una vez,” “una volta,” in vicissitudes of latinity
SH.linkedContent: “one time” in English, but “one turn,” “una vez,” “una volta,” in vicissitudes of latinity

SH.content: “Geheimnis der Begegnung (the secrecy of encounter)” > otherness & solitude (poem, singularity) conjoined in one & same date: chance, plus d’un at once, that which seals event
SH.linkedContent: “Geheimnis der Begegnung (the secrecy of encounter)” > otherness & solitude (poem, singularity) conjoined in one & same date: chance, plus d’un at once, that which seals event

SH.content: anniversary ring—seal > date: spectral return of that which will never return
SH.linkedContent: anniversary ring—seal > date: spectral return of that which will never return

SH.content: ring, sign of belonging itself, condition of return > cipher of seal, imprint of ring, counts more than content of message, what matters is mark of belonging, manifested alliance
SH.linkedContent: ring, sign of belonging itself, condition of return > cipher of seal, imprint of ring, counts more than content of message, what matters is mark of belonging, manifested alliance

SH.content: series of proper names, signatures: face of a seal
SH.linkedContent: series of proper names, signatures: face of a seal

SH.content: pledge, complementary object divide in 2 to seal alliance > moment of engagement, signature, contract, ring [tessera]
SH.linkedContent: pledge, complementary object divide in 2 to seal alliance > moment of engagement, signature, contract, ring [tessera]

F.content: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story
F.linkedContent: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story

F.content: every “word” that says Thing in word-thing > several subjects, places, instances; Wolf Man inhabits forbidden desire to call himself by glorious word, can’t not break seal in signing
F.linkedContent: every “word” that says Thing in word-thing > several subjects, places, instances; Wolf Man inhabits forbidden desire to call himself by glorious word, can’t not break seal in signing

F.content: analyst can only decrypt secret seal of [other, patient’s] name w/ his own name > works on his own name, engaging his own desire
F.linkedContent: analyst can only decrypt secret seal of [other, patient’s] name w/ his own name > works on his own name, engaging his own desire

F.content: “in you, anonymous reader in this much-sealed case”
F.linkedContent: “in you, anonymous reader in this much-sealed case”

ROP.content: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel
ROP.linkedContent: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel

OTO.content: autobiographical récit, tells himself his life, affirms EROS, gratitude for gift (gift: establishment of my own credit w/ this name): EROS signs or seals > before such signature, my life may be mere prejudice (reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return, “yes, yes” to shadowless gift of high noon)
OTO.linkedContent: autobiographical récit, tells himself his life, affirms EROS, gratitude for gift (gift: establishment of my own credit w/ this name): EROS signs or seals > before such signature, my life may be mere prejudice (reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return, “yes, yes” to shadowless gift of high noon)

OTO.content: alliance in which Nietzsche seals/forges his signatures, and simulates them: demonic neutrality of midday delivered from the negative and from dialectic
OTO.linkedContent: alliance in which Nietzsche seals/forges his signatures, and simulates them: demonic neutrality of midday delivered from the negative and from dialectic

O.content: preface—external seal, final kick (coup final), kick-off (coup d’envoi)
O.linkedContent: preface—external seal, final kick (coup final), kick-off (coup d’envoi)

SW.content: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal
SW.linkedContent: [to read the corpus that has known, from operation of other, how to undo itself from veiling/unveiling] you have to write, sign in turn, countersign in writing, something else, in another language, w/out betraying injection/call of first seal

SW.content: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)
SW.linkedContent: can’t prove it happened, only swear that it did: perjury must remain possible (a duty that must be respected)

Gi.content: sexual difference not yet sexual duality? not yet, no longer, sealed by the 2? > “not yet” and “no longer” imply a submission to “the control and inspection of reason (quelque arraisonnement)”
Gi.linkedContent: sexual difference not yet sexual duality? not yet, no longer, sealed by the 2? > “not yet” and “no longer” imply a submission to “the control and inspection of reason (quelque arraisonnement)”

DST.content: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity
DST.linkedContent: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity

TR.content: passion of [Rousseau’s] faith seals virtual time of work, une oeuvre that will operate by itself, beyond its signatory (w/out [Rousseau’s] living assistance [machine])
TR.linkedContent: passion of [Rousseau’s] faith seals virtual time of work, une oeuvre that will operate by itself, beyond its signatory (w/out [Rousseau’s] living assistance [machine])

IW.content: acc. Cohen, Kant: holy of holies, innermost sanctum (die innerste Verwandschaft) of German spirit & Kant represents most intimate affinity w/ Judaism
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, Kant: holy of holies, innermost sanctum (die innerste Verwandschaft) of German spirit & Kant represents most intimate affinity w/ Judaism

IW.content: this kinship (Kant, German, Jew) is sealed in most intimate depth, most essential interiority, is sacredness itself, historical sacredness of spirit
IW.linkedContent: this kinship (Kant, German, Jew) is sealed in most intimate depth, most essential interiority, is sacredness itself, historical sacredness of spirit

D.content: “I” as ghost, as germ, term, that disseminates, a germ that carries w/in itself its own term, se faisant fort de sa mort > le sperme: ferme
D.linkedContent: “I” as ghost, as germ, term, that disseminates, a germ that carries w/in itself its own term, se faisant fort de sa mort > le sperme: ferme

C.content: seal of crypt: contingent, “that’s enough” > Derrida left the seal in tact, truly, didn’t touch it
C.linkedContent: seal of crypt: contingent, “that’s enough” > Derrida left the seal in tact, truly, didn’t touch it

LI.content: if Searle had spoken the obviously true, why the copyright? > the copyright engenders suspicion, divides the seal: Searle’s seal is stolen in advance
LI.linkedContent: if Searle had spoken the obviously true, why the copyright? > the copyright engenders suspicion, divides the seal: Searle’s seal is stolen in advance

TN.content: do eyes touch like lips? what is contact if it intervenes? a sealed interruption, or the continual, negating upheaval (relevante) of the interval—the death of btwn?
TN.linkedContent: do eyes touch like lips? what is contact if it intervenes? a sealed interruption, or the continual, negating upheaval (relevante) of the interval—the death of btwn?

ATM.content: [Levinas’ negotiation w/ interruption and reappropriation] is a style, an idiom that marks the negotiation w/ a singular and irreplaceable seal
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ negotiation w/ interruption and reappropriation] is a style, an idiom that marks the negotiation w/ a singular and irreplaceable seal

ATM.content: Derrida’s fault/violence against Levinas’ work can only wound Him [i.e. not EL] in his body, He/Il that preseals everything that carries a name > Derrida compares his fault to that of erasing God’s name from a book (a fault that is buried, mourned [not annihilated])
ATM.linkedContent: Derrida’s fault/violence against Levinas’ work can only wound Him [i.e. not EL] in his body, He/Il that preseals everything that carries a name > Derrida compares his fault to that of erasing God’s name from a book (a fault that is buried, mourned [not annihilated])

OG.content: that Lévi-Strauss will not be punished [for tricking girls into giving him names] gives to his fault an irremediable stamp (sceau)
OG.linkedContent: that Lévi-Strauss will not be punished [for tricking girls into giving him names] gives to his fault an irremediable stamp (sceau)

OG.content: “que la langage doive traverser l’espace, soi tenu de s’espacer, ce n’est pas là un trait accidentel mais le sceau do son origine—la dispersion originelle laisse sa marque dans la langage”
OG.linkedContent: “que la langage doive traverser l’espace, soi tenu de s’espacer, ce n’est pas là un trait accidentel mais le sceau do son origine—la dispersion originelle laisse sa marque dans la langage”

ATAP.content: John Patmos’ double bind: “do not seal the words of the inspiration of this book” > must disobey in order to obey: problem of translation re: quotation marks (“I, Yéshoua”)
ATAP.linkedContent: John Patmos’ double bind: “do not seal the words of the inspiration of this book” > must disobey in order to obey: problem of translation re: quotation marks (“I, Yéshoua”)

ATAP.content: “do not seal”: i.e. do not close, do not sign
ATAP.linkedContent: “do not seal”: i.e. do not close, do not sign

SPEC.content: Freud’s avoidance of philosophy [of Nietzsche] (already in place like a counterfeiter) is inevitable (closest avoided in inevitable itself) > that the da be fort even before a judgment of denegation vienne y apposer la spécificité de son sceau
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s avoidance of philosophy [of Nietzsche] (already in place like a counterfeiter) is inevitable (closest avoided in inevitable itself) > that the da be fort even before a judgment of denegation vienne y apposer la spécificité de son sceau

SPEC.content: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices
SPEC.linkedContent: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices
